lead_paragraph: STANTON--Reginald, graduate of Xavier High School, St Peter's College, Balliol College Oxford University (Rhodes Scholarship), and NYU School of Law (Root-Tilden Scholar), passed away at his home in Morristown, NJ. He was 83. Reginald was appointed to the bench of the Superior Court of New Jersey in 1975, serving as Assignment Judge of Morris and Sussex Counties from 1985 until 2003. Upon his retirement from the bench, he was Of Counsel at Drinker, Biddle & Reath. Reginald taught at Seton Hall Law School and the National Judicial College, was a board member of the Morris County School of Technology, and a long-time member of the Rhodes Scholarship selection committee. Reginald is lovingly remembered by his wife, Marie (Gerne) Stanton, their two children, and six grandchildren. Funeral services are under the care of Doyle Funeral Home, Morristown, NJ. 1/3
